abstract: Whirlpool reports third-quarter profit of $177 million, or $2.27 per share, compared with profit of $79 million, or $1.02 per share, in year-ago quarter; revenue was $4.63 billion, up 2 percent; firm will cut 5,000 jobs, about 10 percent of its work force in North America and Europe, due to weak demand.
snippet: The world’s biggest appliance maker will trim 5,000 jobs in Europe and North America because of weak demand.
lead_paragraph: The world’s biggest appliance maker will trim 5,000 jobs in Europe and North America because of weak demand.

headline.main: Whirlpool Misses Expectations and Will Cut Jobs
headline.print_headline: Whirlpool Misses Expectations and Will Cut Jobs
headline.seo: Whirlpool Misses Expectations and Will Cut Jobs
